posts.name: Luciana
posts.cooked:
We are a rookie team and have been having some problems connecting the roborio to the driver station. We reimaged the SD card and then connected the roborio to our laptop so the communications began working but when we try to upload the code it would say build failed. Also the radio light in the roborio won’t light up but the radio itself does. This is the exact error message:

Task :discoverroborio Discovering Target roborio admin @ null: Resolved but not connected. Reason: RuntimeException com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect admin @ roborio-10211- FRC : Resolved but not connected. Reason: RuntimeException com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect admin @ 172.22.11.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: RuntimeException com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect admin @ 10.102.11.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException Discovery timed out. admin @ roborio-10211- FRC .local: Resolved but not connected. Reason: RuntimeException com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect admin @ roborio-10211- FRC .lan: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException Unknown Host admin @ roborio-10211- FRC .frc-field.local: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException Unknown Host Run with --info for more details

GradleRIO detected this build failed due to not being able to find “roborio”! Scroll up in this error log for more information.

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

What went wrong: Execution failed for task ‘:discoverroborio’.

A failure occurred while executing edu.wpi.first.deployutils.deploy.target.discovery.TargetDiscoveryWorker Target roborio could not be found at any location! See above for more details.

Try:

Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. Run with --scan to get full insights. Get more help at https://help.gradle.org .

BUILD FAILED in 9s 4 actionable tasks: 2 executed, 2 up-to-date

The terminal process “cmd.exe /d /c gradlew deploy -PteamNumber=10211 --offline -Dorg.gradle.java.home=“C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2024\jdk”” terminated with exit code: 1.

Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it.

posts.name: Kyle Burman
posts.cooked: Is your radio properly configured, and is there an Ethernet connecting the radio and the robot

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Did you set the team number of the Rio after imaging the SD card?

posts.name: Luciana
posts.cooked: I’m working on reconfiguring the radio and yes there is an Ethernet cable connecting the radio and the robot, also I did properly set the team number of the Rio after imaging. Right now I’m trying to connect the radio to my laptop but it wasn’t working so I’m currently troubleshooting it and for that I have to download Network Assistant program according to the frc guide but it wasn’t letting me run it as administrator so I had to create a new user in my laptop to try and run the program.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Unlikely to be the cause of the connection problem, but you’re using WPILib 2024, and you’ll need to use the 2025 version to work with the image required in R701

posts.name: Luciana
posts.cooked:
When I go to update WPILib it says there are no updates available. Also, update, it still doesn’t let me run the program as administrator: IMG_8115 4032×3024 3.92 MB

IMG_8115 4032×3024 3.92 MB

IMG_8115 4032×3024 3.92 MB

I’m right clicking the file but it only gives me the option to “open”

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
lusyi:

When I go to update WPILib it says there are no updates available.

Upgrading WPILib is done by downloading and running the new installer per the documentation: WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Luciana
posts.cooked:
Besides the WPILib update I managed to run the program as administrator but now I’m trying to configure the radio but this error keeps appearing even though I have it properly connected: IMG_8116 4032×3024 4.51 MB

IMG_8116 4032×3024 4.51 MB

IMG_8116 4032×3024 4.51 MB
